channel.title: üè¢ Google DeepMind on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Google DeepMind on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: CAT3D: Create Anything in 3D with Multi-View Diffusion Models
item.description: CAT3D: Generate high-quality 3D scenes from as little as one image using a novel multi-view diffusion model, outperforming existing methods in speed and quality.

item.title: Learning rigid-body simulators over implicit shapes for large-scale scenes and vision
item.description: SDF-Sim: A novel learned rigid-body simulator that leverages SDFs to achieve unprecedented scalability, enabling simulations with hundreds of objects and millions of nodes.

item.title: Many-Shot In-Context Learning
item.description: Scaling up in-context learning using thousands of examples significantly boosts Large Language Model (LLM) performance, particularly for complex tasks. Novel training methods mitigate reliance on hum…

item.title: Moving Off-the-Grid: Scene-Grounded Video Representations
item.description: MooG: Self-supervised video model learns off-the-grid representations, enabling consistent scene element tracking even with motion; outperforming grid-based baselines on various vision tasks.

item.title: Neglected Hessian component explains mysteries in sharpness regularization
item.description: Deep learning’s mysteries surrounding sharpness regularization are solved by uncovering the crucial role of the neglected Hessian component, the Nonlinear Modeling Error (NME).

item.title: Neural Assets: 3D-Aware Multi-Object Scene Synthesis with Image Diffusion Models
item.description: Neural Assets enables intuitive 3D multi-object scene editing via image diffusion models by using per-object representations to control individual object poses, achieving state-of-the-art results.

item.title: Schrodinger Bridge Flow for Unpaired Data Translation
item.description: Accelerate unpaired data translation with Schr√∂dinger Bridge Flow, a novel algorithm solving optimal transport problems efficiently without repeatedly training models!

item.title: Time-Reversal Provides Unsupervised Feedback to LLMs
item.description: Time-reversed language models provide unsupervised feedback for improving LLMs, offering a cost-effective alternative to human feedback and enhancing LLM safety.

item.title: What type of inference is planning?
item.description: Planning is redefined as a distinct inference type within a variational framework, enabling efficient approximate planning in complex environments.
